title: China Urges Local Firms to Avoid Nvidia H20 Chips
description: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss reports that China is urging its domestic companies to avoid using Nvidia H20 chips. Plus, Elon Musk accuses Apple of favoring OpenAI above other AI companies in its app store, even threatening possible legal action. And Circle CEO Jeremy Allaire discusses plans for new products as shares of the company soar following its earnings report. (Source: Bloomberg)

summary: China has urged local firms to avoid using Nvidia' H20 processors, a technology developed by the company that produces the H20 Processors. This comes after China's President, President Xi Jinping, made a deal with NVIDIA and AMD to create a revenue split on ACCELERATOR SALES in China. The H20's were reportedly sought by Chinese authorities who have been urging local companies to stop using them. The news of this prompted "BLOOMBERG Tech" to discuss the potential impact on the global market. The NASDAQ 100, the S & P 500, was up by only 0.6% as the market adjusts to CPI and consumer price inflation. The question is whether the Chinese government will continue to pursue this strategy, which could potentially impact the market.
